blocks.content: Web server misconfigurations happen when the server is not set up correctly. This creates security gaps. In naval style, it is like a warship leaving an important gate open or exposing tools on deck for enemies to see.

content: Default settings left unchanged
Weak or no authentication
Old or outdated software
Directory listing enabled
Exposed backup files or logs
Default Credentials – Admin/admin or root/root still active
Directory Listing – Allows attackers to view hidden folders
Unpatched Servers – Old software with known vulnerabilities
Verbose Error Messages – Shows server details to attackers
Open Debug Modes – Exposes internal system info
Unrestricted File Upload – Allows dangerous files to be uploaded

blocks.content: Burp Suite is a powerful web testing tool used to intercept, modify, and analyze web traffic. In naval style, it is like placing a communication interceptor between two ships to understand the full message flow.

content: Step 1: Open Burp Suite
Why: Starts the web security testing platform.
Step 2: Go to Proxy > Intercept
Why: To capture requests between browser and server.
Step 3: Set browser proxy to 127.0.0.1:8080
Why: Sends all browser traffic through Burp Suite.
Step 4: Install Burp Certificate in browser
Why: To avoid HTTPS warnings and read encrypted traffic.
Step 5: Turn Intercept ON/OFF based on testing
Why: Control when to capture requests.

blocks.content: WHAT YOU CAN TEST WITH BURP SUITE

content: Check how login forms work
Modify requests before sending
Find insecure parameters
Test hidden pages and directories
Analyze server responses
